intro: Wikstroemia quinoderma, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a waxy texture. Wikstroemia quinoderma is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks.
